ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: dueling magicians
ygData.msgSnippet: hehe in duels I am never nice ;)  It s a duel to the death, I play to win. I ll be darned if I m not going to use a tactic just because Verant can t fix their
ygData.messageBody:
hehe in duels I am never nice ;) It's a duel to the death, I play to win.
I'll be darned if I'm not going to use a tactic just because Verant can't
fix their bugs. If they hadn't coded it so I couldn't charm the pet then
I'd charm the pet and beat him with it so he wouldn't lose xp.

Unfortunately Verant took that route away from me so I just charm the owner
now.

Some don't like that. Oh well. All is fair in love and war. Duels are
combat. Duels are war.

Lyrnia Jongleur
Bard of Norrath


----- Original Message -----
From: "Cranfill, Wendy" <Wendy_Cranfill@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, June 01, 2000 3:20 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: dueling magicians


> Ouch, viscous....
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 01, 2000 1:19 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: dueling magicians
>
> Few tips:
>
> 1) Do not group with him
> 2) Charm him and make him attack his pet (he can't cast
> spells at all, pet
> may even kill him before charm wears off)
> 3) Rinse and repeat
>
> Then for variety, run off with his pet in hot pursuit, chain
> pet then run
> back. Pet will get lost because it's so far away from him.
> Kill him when
> you get back, he can't make a new pet so he's even more
> helpless than a
> wizzie. When he dies pet goes poof.
>
> Lyrnia
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <beatdropbattledrum@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Thursday, June 01, 2000 3:02 PM
> Subject: [eqbards] Re: dueling magicians
>
>
> > I have dueled a mage once before. I lost, but I learned
> something.
> > 1) You can't charm the pet. 2) You can't charm people
> you are
> > grouped with.
> >
> > There was a bug where I tried charming the pet and it
> didn't work.
> > But once he killed me, his pet went berserk and attacked
> him... he
> > almost died. I say, get him back for your guild mates.
> Charm HIM
> > into attacking his pet. Let his pet kill him and he will
> lose exp
> > ;) He will love that!
> >
> > ~Beatdrop Battledrum
> > 43rd Bard of the Karana Server
> >
> > --- In eqbards@egroups.com, Bill Costlow <atlatyl@y...>
> wrote:
> > > A magician in my guild has been bragging for several
> > > days now about how great he is. He's dueled several
> > > players in my guild that are 2-3 lvls higher and
> > > defeated them (one was killed by his pet;-( )
> > >
> > > Anyway as I approach 30th lvl I expect to be
> > > challenged by this guy and, since his attitude really
> > > gets me going anyway, *really* don't want to lose...
> > >
> > > I have never dueled...I am more into the group and
> > > make friends aspect of this game.
> > >
> > > So far I figure pixie strike, song of siriens guardian
> > > and elemental rythmns will be my main songs....weapons
> > > are a T claw and gnoll hide lariet. (I also have a
> > > silvery axe but figure stunning is a good thing with a
> > > caster....)
> > >
> > > Any suggestions?
> > >
> > > __________________________________________________
